title: Alphakilo
author: Alphakilo
content: I have a strong interest in innovation, pushing the limit of what is possible, and perhaps what the future holds. Regarding promoting gender diversity and inclusivity, I would definitely like to see more. I'm quite curious in the projects you come across where the use of cryptocurrencies has broken new grounds and motivated people to think outside the box. Which of the projects you've seen has inspired you the most and helped others to see and think beyond existing limitations?

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: Investment is already the number one answer here. Cryptocurrency or Bitcoin investment allows people to transact with complete anonymity and thus gender discrimination or honestly any form of discrimination happens here.

comments.author: digaran
comments.body: Quote from: Alphakilo on October 15, 2023, 02:24:58 PMI have a strong interest in innovation, pushing the limit of what is possible, and perhaps what the future holds. Regarding promoting gender diversity and inclusivity, I would definitely like to see more. I'm quite curious in the projects you come across where the use of cryptocurrencies has broken new grounds and motivated people to think outside the box. Which of the projects you've seen has inspired you the most and helped others to see and think beyond existing limitations?At least give us one project you were inspired by, then we will continue from there. I'm curious to know what exactly is  promoting gender anarchy you are referring to? What is the correlation of gender "diversity" and Bitcoin?Just give me one good example of "outside the box" project other than Bitcoin, though Bitcoin isn't just outside the box, it actually torn the box to pieces, so there is no box anymore to think outside of.

comments.author: OcTradism
comments.body: Quote from: Alphakilo on October 15, 2023, 02:24:58 PMI'm quite curious in the projects you come across where the use of cryptocurrencies has broken new grounds and motivated people to think outside the box. Which of the projects you've seen has inspired you the most and helped others to see and think beyond existing limitations?Thinking out of a box is good as it can help you to break your own limits but in cryptocurrency, if you apply it wrongly, you will make big mistake and get big loss.Don't try to think out of a box like "I want to find hidden gems (mean altcoins) and I no longer see good chance to earn great profit with Bitcoin". It's how people lost their money in many scam altcoins. Don't think out of Bitcoin box as many scam altcoin boxes wait you to fall into.How many cryptocurrencies failed?

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: New projects are not supposed to be boring because we are talking about economic projects whose role is to improve the nature of money and the ability to distribute it, and there is no central party that controls or can cancel or reverse its transactions, which is possible in most alternative currencies, but the expansion of currencies into areas that are not directly related to them, such as storing images. Or video clips, or even trying to send messages on it.The important areas that most projects lack and look for are privacy, scalability, how to add more users without affecting fees, and decentralization.

comments.author: Alpha Marine
comments.body: I don't know how this can relate to gender but I know Bitcoin set the standard too high for anybody to think out of the box. Anybody that is thinking out of the box has to bring something better than Bitcoin and as far as the cryptocurrency industry is concerned, nobody has been able to manage that. Most people that try to outdo Bitcoin just end up making an inferior version of Bitcoin.Most innovations that seem to be on the level of Bitcoin can't withstand the test of time. We saw it with NFTs. NFTs were like the new Bitcoin because of the hype but look how it turned out.Blockchain technology is a very interesting one too, perhaps more innovational than Bitcoin Lightening networks and Bitcoin mixers are nice innovations we can talk about when talking about innovations. But when we talk about coins and tokens and NFTs and whatever, nothing has come close to Bitcoin.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Quote from: Alphakilo on October 15, 2023, 02:24:58 PMI have a strong interest in innovation, pushing the limit of what is possible, and perhaps what the future holds. Regarding promoting gender diversity and inclusivity, I would definitely like to see more. I'm quite curious in the projects you come across where the use of cryptocurrencies has broken new grounds and motivated people to think outside the box. Which of the projects you've seen has inspired you the most and helped others to see and think beyond existing limitations?Bitcoin. Everything else is just another way to make money. In all these numerous useless altcoins, there is very little innovation and no real use. If you want to open new horizons for yourself, start studying bitcoin, its technology and use bitcoin not as a means for speculation, but as a payment instrument. Then you will seriously expand your horizons.

comments.author: goaldigger
comments.body: Quote from: dothebeats on October 16, 2023, 03:29:45 AMInvestment is already the number one answer here. Cryptocurrency or Bitcoin investment allows people to transact with complete anonymity and thus gender discrimination or honestly any form of discrimination happens here.This will depend on the project you’re investing with and honestly, being anonymous here is slowly fading due to the reason of regulations and the KYC. I don’t any project that focuses on this purpose as most of the project focuses more on making profit than to actually offer a service that can help many. Seriously, the project today is not that innovative anymore, unlike before where we can see big innovations and technology as well.

comments.author: justdimin
comments.body: Quote from: Husires on October 19, 2023, 04:28:29 AMNew projects are not supposed to be boring because we are talking about economic projects whose role is to improve the nature of money and the ability to distribute it, and there is no central party that controls or can cancel or reverse its transactions, which is possible in most alternative currencies, but the expansion of currencies into areas that are not directly related to them, such as storing images. Or video clips, or even trying to send messages on it.Yes and if they are boring, no one will ever get interested on them because there were lots of existing projects already and each of them has an interesting feature. But I think most are not decentralized. Despite of it, many people seem to not care at all. Cryptos have gone too far and there are now those so-called " expansions " you said which are also known as NFT's. This is great to witness but as expected there are also those scams. I only feel sorry for those who lost big money on them but it might also be their fault for not taking precautions. Quote from: Husires on October 19, 2023, 04:28:29 AMThe important areas that most projects lack and look for are privacy, scalability, how to add more users without affecting fees, and decentralization.Agree on most of them but not scalability. Can't you see, there are now bunch of L1 and L2 projects? There are also ZK but IDK if they are different. All I know is they solve scalability issues.

comments.author: Jating
comments.body: Quote from: Alphakilo on October 15, 2023, 02:24:58 PMI have a strong interest in innovation, pushing the limit of what is possible, and perhaps what the future holds. Regarding promoting gender diversity and inclusivity, I would definitely like to see more. I'm quite curious in the projects you come across where the use of cryptocurrencies has broken new grounds and motivated people to think outside the box. Which of the projects you've seen has inspired you the most and helped others to see and think beyond existing limitations?We wouldn't have interesting in innovation? We are here to invest and see projects that we know could be the trend setter in the future? We've seen projects that affected the following industry or sector,>> Health care>> Real State ownership>> Energy>> IoT>> Banking System>> Remittances/Payment System>> Game PlayAnd there could be more to come in the future, however, it case of promoting gender diversity, do we really need crypto based or blockchain projects for that? There are a lot of groups that has been advocating it, in my opinion.With that, we will love to hear your thoughts on how we can used projects to promote that?Or what will be the next biggest thing?

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: Alphakilo on October 15, 2023, 02:24:58 PMI have a strong interest in innovation, pushing the limit of what is possible, and perhaps what the future holds. Regarding promoting gender diversity and inclusivity, I would definitely like to see more. I'm quite curious in the projects you come across where the use of cryptocurrencies has broken new grounds and motivated people to think outside the box. Which of the projects you've seen has inspired you the most and helped others to see and think beyond existing limitations?I haven't seen any altcoin project that works in the direction that you seek information around,  because from your writing you haven't given us any guide as to what the category of the projects that belong to that class is and how best to safeguard our investment in that direction,  and the only cryptocurrency that gives such thing as inclusion for all gender should be bitcoin,  but since Bitcoin doesn't belong here I will thereafter choosing Ethereum and at best it is a thing of luck and not gender inequality. We haven't seen any specific projects that seek to address the issue of gender crisis because that aspect has nothing or little to do with crypto space since coin development is more of a financial activity rather than it is a gender thing at most.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: Well, the number of cryptocurrency enthusiasts in this era is already a miracle, right? It started with Bitcoin with just thousands of people who believe in this technology and now I bet there are millions who are either investing their money in cryptocurrencies, using it as their means to gamble, trading and who knows if they are also using it to buy their needs in the market. That's already a part of shaping the future so there's no doubt we are in an era where more people are getting used to this type of technology and it's not stopping anytime. One thing that inspired me the most is how fast an investment could grow in this industry. I have tried saving in banks and investing somewhere else but you cannot even compare it to how better it is at investing in cryptocurrencies. Risky, that's true. But if you find the right choice then you can multiply your money by 10 and maybe more without hard work. Being the manager of your own investment is something I just wished for before and now we can really do it by ourselves.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: Alphakilo on October 15, 2023, 02:24:58 PMI have a strong interest in innovation, pushing the limit of what is possible, and perhaps what the future holds. Regarding promoting gender diversity and inclusivity, I would definitely like to see more. I'm quite curious in the projects you come across where the use of cryptocurrencies has broken new grounds and motivated people to think outside the box. Which of the projects you've seen has inspired you the most and helped others to see and think beyond existing limitations?For me, it's Bitcoin, everything you've mentioned is on Bitcoin, Bitcoin inspired people and think beyond existing limitations, all these altcoins are just trying to duplicate what Bitcoin achieved whenever you see new projects coming in, it always reminds us of Bitcoin, actually we don't need many altcoins in the market, its only goal is to make the developers rich and for early investors to make a profit.We only need Bitcoin because it's the perfect Cryptocurrency, so many new coins that come in promoting themselves better than Bitcoin but where are they now, they all end up as shitcoin.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Quote from: danherbias07 on October 22, 2023, 01:22:28 PMRisky, that's true. But if you find the right choice then you can multiply your money by 10 and maybe more without hard work. Being the manager of your own investment is something I just wished for before and now we can really do it by ourselves.During the global bull run, you can randomly invest in any coin you come across and it makes a profit. Noticed this in 2017 and in 2021. Works the same way. The problem with such investments and their investors is that they can't stop and lock in their profits. Want more profits and they keep holding on to their coins without selling them. Then it turns out that when they thought they didn't get enough profit, it was the peak of their coins and it was the best time to sell. Many altcoin investors suffer from the fact that they are unable to lock in profits from their investments in time, they are consumed by greed.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: So far, every projects and concepts inside crypto universe involving political agendas and ideologies have failed drastically. Some developers have already tried showing their support to politicians, religions and their ideas through the creation of tokens, but they weren't widely adopted by the community and fade out really fast. And I guess the same applies to gender ideology and its ramifications. You can still try developing your own project focused on this niche to see what happens, though.Anyway, Bitcoin is the currency which is going to shape the future of this market for a long time yet. It's not only the most inspiring, but also the most solid and reliable one among every other alternatives around.

comments.author: VFalcon
comments.body: I was inspired by Fairspin's new Fruit bounty bonanza tournament. They are constantly running some kind of tournaments and giveaways, I got my first crypto investment money there and it turned out to be pretty easy. I got 120$ at the last tournament, maybe you can get more than that

comments.author: bluebit25
comments.body: First is Bitcoin, I have to use the word "grateful" to express to bitcoin all the things it brings. A wealth of knowledge about the economy, the workings of finance, and how Bitcoin works is impacting and that gives confidence in a future of crypto adoption. Then there is the rest of this market, altcoins give me a sense of convenient crypto usage, although it is sometimes manipulated due to the young investment environment. But the fields that we have seen appear such as IoT, AI, web3, health, energy, education,... are promising fields in the development period of the future of digital technology.

comments.author: Bitcoinpoly
comments.body: Quote from: Alphakilo on October 15, 2023, 02:24:58 PMI have a strong interest in innovation, pushing the limit of what is possible, and perhaps what the future holds. Regarding promoting gender diversity and inclusivity, I would definitely like to see more. I'm quite curious in the projects you come across where the use of cryptocurrencies has broken new grounds and motivated people to think outside the box. Which of the projects you've seen has inspired you the most and helped others to see and think beyond existing limitations?OP there are lots of innovative projects we can actually look into just like the SOMESING project which is meant to compensate singers and producers. If you post your own song in SOMESING, a song wallet will automatically be formed, and $SSX will be accumulated in various ways, including gifts, supports, and events in this song wallet. After a certain period of time, you will automatically distribute the coins that you have accumulated in your song wallet to the participants who have enjoyed this song and have contributed to it through smart contract. You can send the token to an exchange who has the token listed and convert it to USDT, just of recent the token got listed on Bitget exchange.

comments.author: GeorgeJohn
comments.body: Quote from: Alphakilo on October 15, 2023, 02:24:58 PMI have a strong interest in innovation, pushing the limit of what is possible, and perhaps what the future holds. Regarding promoting gender diversity and inclusivity, I would definitely like to see more. I'm quite curious in the projects you come across where the use of cryptocurrencies has broken new grounds and motivated people to think outside the box. Which of the projects you've seen has inspired you the most and helped others to see and think beyond existing limitations?In a cryptocurrency we have the best among all which is bitcoin and any other cryptocurrencies lies under bitcoin for acceleration in price, so nobody that's into cryptocurrency that doesn't know that bitcoin is the pioneer of other cryptocurrencies, because whenever Bitcoin is on bearish other coins devalues and whenever Bitcoin price rises other coins regain potential.So from the look at cryptocurrency investment the first thing that will come to someone mind during investment is bitcoin and secondly in sub branches of bitcoin, the another one to be invest on is ethereum, people invest on the potentialities of the coins,  so apart from bitcoin to mentioned as a number of cryptocurrency, I will say that bitcoin is the number one in which nobody will say anything about it, secondly ethereum, litecoin, dogecoin..but people like to invest in altcoins so that when their is bearish they will be profit.

comments.author: justdimin
comments.body: Quote from: danherbias07 on October 22, 2023, 01:22:28 PMWell, the number of cryptocurrency enthusiasts in this era is already a miracle, right? It started with Bitcoin with just thousands of people who believe in this technology and now I bet there are millions who are either investing their money in cryptocurrencies, using it as their means to gamble, trading and who knows if they are also using it to buy their needs in the market. That's already a part of shaping the future so there's no doubt we are in an era where more people are getting used to this type of technology and it's not stopping anytime. Not thousand but lower than it. It's hard for the many to be convinced with Bitcoin back in the early time. The price skyrocketing and the adoption from big names is what helped them. BTC is a currency. This is it's primary use but there were also lots of people who use their BTC to activities that you said.There are still people who tries to stop it but they aren't really a big threat anymore. So, there is no need to worry about them. Cryptos may be fast growing but what about when dumping? While other investments are seem to be more stable than it. There is a hard work here. Resisting ones emotion is already an example. So you deserved it if you successfully earn. Quote from: danherbias07 on October 22, 2023, 01:22:28 PMBeing the manager of your own investment is something I just wished for before and now we can really do it by ourselves.Oh really? Didn't knew that, but I think people are only wishing for a decentralized currency before, and that is why BTC was created. But it's great that BTC can serve the same purpose. This is its other advantage compared to investing in banks and other centralized platforms/assets.
